laws.title: Voluntarily causing hurt
laws.description: Whoever, except in the case provided by law, voluntarily causes hurt shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

laws.title: Voluntarily causing hurt by means of poison, etc.
laws.description: Whoever, except in the case provided by law, by means of poison or any harmful substance attempts to cause, or knowing that he is likely thereby to cause, hurt to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

laws.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
laws.description: Whoever, except in the case provided by law, voluntarily causes grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine which may extend to one thousand rupees.

laws.title: Act endangering life or personal safety
laws.description: Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred and fifty rupees, or with both.

laws.title: Wrongful restraint
laws.description: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred and fifty rupees, or with both.

laws.title: Wrongful confinement
laws.description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

filing_procedure: File First Information Report (FIR) at nearest police station
Provide detailed description of the assault incident
Mention date, time, location, and witnesses present
Get medical examination done immediately (within 24 hours ideally)
Collect medical certificates and photographs of injuries
File complaint before Magistrate if police refuses to file FIR
Preserve evidence (torn clothes, weapons used, etc.)
Get written FIR acknowledgement
Follow up with investigating officer regularly

laws.title: Rape
laws.description: A man is said to commit 'rape' if he penetrates his penis into the vagina, mouth, anus or urethra of a woman or makes her do so, by coercion, abuse of authority or when she is incapable of giving consent.

laws.title: Punishment for rape
laws.description: Rigorous imprisonment of not less than 7 years but which may be for life, and also liable to fine and/or death penalty in case of aggravated rape.

laws.title: Rape by husband on wife during separation
laws.description: When a man commits rape on his wife who is living separate from him, he shall be punished with imprisonment of not less than 2 years.

laws.act: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012
laws.title: Punishment for penetrative sexual assault on a child
laws.description: For a child below 16 years: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 7 years and fine up to 1 lakh rupees. For 16-18 years: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 5 years.

laws.act: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012
laws.title: Punishment for aggravated penetrative sexual assault
laws.description: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years or life imprisonment and fine up to 1 lakh rupees.

laws.title: Disclosure of identity of victim of rape
laws.description: No information shall be published in any form which discloses or tends to disclose the identity of a victim of rape.

filing_procedure: Go to nearest police station or emergency services immediately
Report to female police officer if available (women can request this)
File FIR and get copy within 30 minutes
Do NOT bathe or change clothes before medical examination
Get medical examination at government hospital within 24 hours
Collect detailed medical report documenting injury, semen, DNA
Obtain photographs of all injuries
Provide complete statement to investigating officer
Inform police about any CCTV footage or witnesses
Request police to preserve all physical evidence
Apply for victim compensation under Victim Compensation Scheme
Request counseling support from NGOs
File anticipatory bail application if threatened by accused
Intimate court about threats or pressure to withdraw complaint

laws.title: Obscene acts and songs
laws.description: Outraging modesty through words, sounds, gestures intended to be seen by woman is punishable with imprisonment up to 3 months or fine up to 200 rupees or both.

laws.title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
laws.description: First offence: Imprisonment up to 3 months or fine up to 200 rupees or both. Subsequent offence: Imprisonment up to 6 months or fine up to 500 rupees or both.

laws.act: Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013
laws.title: Definition of sexual harassment at workplace
laws.description: Includes unwelcome verbal, non-verbal or physical conduct of sexual nature affecting dignity of woman at work.

laws.act: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012
laws.title: Punishment for sexual harassment of a child
laws.description: Imprisonment of up to 5 years and fine up to 50,000 rupees for a child below 16, and 3 years and 25,000 rupees for child 16-18 years.

laws.title: Punishment for publishing obscene material in electronic form
laws.description: Punishment up to 5 years imprisonment and fine up to 10 lakh rupees.

filing_procedure: File written complaint with employer/institution
Complaint should contain specific dates, times, and nature of harassment
Request Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) action within 7 days
Simultaneously file police complaint if harassment involves threats
File police FIR under IPC Section 509 or 294
Preserve all evidence: messages, emails, letters, recordings (legal)
Get statements from witnesses in writing
Request police for interim protective order
Apply for restraining order against harasser
Keep copies of all formal communication
Follow up with ICC regularly (max 90 days for resolution)
Appeal to external agency if not satisfied with ICC decision
File complaint with District Commission if institutional response inadequate

laws.title: Abolition of Untouchability
laws.description: Untouchability is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden. The enforcement of any disability arising out of untouchability is made a punishable offence.

laws.act: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989
laws.title: Punishment for atrocities
laws.description: Various offences listed including causing hurt, denial of access to water, denial of common passage, desecration of symbols. Punishment ranges from 6 months to 5 years imprisonment.

laws.act: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989
laws.title: Offence of insulting caste
laws.description: Using words, signs or representations that insult or suggest inferiority because of caste. Punishment: Not less than 6 months and up to 5 years imprisonment, and fine up to 5000 rupees.

laws.title: Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of caste
laws.description: Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 500 rupees.

laws.title: Injuring or defiling place of worship
laws.description: Defiling caste symbols or sacred objects. Punishment up to 2 years imprisonment and fine up to 1000 rupees.

filing_procedure: Immediately report to police with detailed complaint
Provide evidence: audio/video recordings, photographs, messages
Get statements from all witnesses in writing
Register police complaint under SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act
Request police to invoke provisions of Prevention of Atrocities Act (stricter than regular IPC)
File complaint with District Magistrate if police refuses
Approach National Commission for Scheduled Castes (NCSC)
File complaint with Human Rights Commission if institutional response inadequate
Collect medical certificates if physical assault involved
Apply for victim compensation immediately
Request anticipatory bail if threatened with counter-cases
Engage with legal aid organization for representation
Keep media informed to create public awareness (if safe to do so)

laws.title: Wantonly provoking any class by insults, &c.
laws.description: Acts intended or knowing to provoke breach of peace by insulting a person or class based on race/place of birth. Punishment up to 1 year imprisonment and fine up to 1000 rupees.

laws.title: Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of caste, race
laws.description: Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 500 rupees.

laws.title: Injuring or defiling place of worship
laws.description: If symbols are defiled. Punishment up to 2 years and fine up to 1000 rupees.

laws.title: Punishment for impersonation using computer resource
laws.description: If racist content posted using fake identity. Punishment up to 3 years and fine up to 1 lakh rupees.

filing_procedure: File detailed police complaint with specific racist statements/incidents
Provide evidence: screenshots, messages, videos, recordings
Get witness statements
Request police to register case under IPC Section 153A
For online racism: Report to cyber police cell with URLs/screenshots
File complaint with Human Rights Commission
Contact National Commission for Minorities if applicable
Collect evidence of psychological impact (mental health records)
Apply for restraining order/injunction
Request police protection if threatened
Escalate to senior police officer if local police unresponsive

laws.section: Central Government Prohibition of Ragging Bill, 1998
laws.title: Definition and prohibition of ragging
laws.description: Ragging is banned in all educational institutions. Various forms including physical abuse, psychological harassment, sexual abuse, and violations of dignity.

laws.title: Act endangering life or personal safety
laws.description: Rash or negligent acts endangering life. Punishment up to 3 months imprisonment and fine up to 250 rupees.

laws.title: Criminal force, wrongful restraint, confinement
laws.description: Unlawful restraint and confinement. Punishment ranging from 1 month to 1 year.

laws.title: Rape and sexual assault
laws.description: If ragging involves sexual abuse. Rigorous imprisonment of 7 years to life.

laws.act: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012
laws.title: If ragging involves children
laws.description: Punishment up to 5-10 years for sexual offences against children.

filing_procedure: Report immediately to college/institution anti-ragging committee
File written complaint with specific names, dates, and descriptions
Request protection measures before investigation
Simultaneously file police complaint if police intervention needed
File FIR under Anti-Ragging Act provisions
Collect medical certificates if physical injury occurred
Get witness statements from fellow students
Preserve evidence: messages, videos, photographs
Request interim protective measures (relocation, changed schedule)
File complaint with UGC Anti-Ragging Cell (ragging.uchd.ac.in)
Seek legal aid for representation
Request academic safeguards while complaint is pending
Escalate to principal/management if committee is biased
Contact National Human Rights Commission if state authorities unresponsive

laws.title: Criminal intimidation
laws.description: Whoever intentionally puts any person in fear of any injury commits criminal intimidation. Punishment up to 2 years imprisonment, fine up to 500 rupees, or both.

laws.title: Insult with intent to provoke breach of peace
laws.description: Intentional insult intending to provoke breach of peace. Punishment up to 2 years imprisonment and fine up to 500 rupees.

laws.title: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication or rumor
laws.description: Threatening another with injury. Punishment up to 6 months imprisonment and fine up to 300 rupees (simple intimidation) or up to 2 years and fine up to 1000 rupees (aggravated).

laws.title: Identity theft
laws.description: If threatening through fake accounts. Punishment up to 3 years and fine up to 1 lakh rupees.

laws.title: Publishing obscene material in electronic form
laws.description: If threats include obscene content. Punishment up to 5 years and fine up to 10 lakh rupees.

filing_procedure: Immediately file police complaint with FIR
Provide all threatening communications: messages, emails, calls, letters
Get written statements from witnesses who heard/saw threats
Request police protection (if life is in imminent danger)
Request anticipatory bail if threatened with false cases
Preserve all evidence in original format (do not edit)
File for restraining order/injunction from court
Request recording of phone threats (if made over call)
File cyber complaint if threats made online
Report to social media platform if threats posted publicly
Keep police informed of any escalation
Apply for ex-parte injunction if threat is immediate
Request witness protection order

laws.title: Criminal intimidation and threats
laws.description: Online threats and intimidation. Punishment up to 2 years imprisonment and fine up to 500-1000 rupees.

laws.title: Punishment for sending offensive messages through communication service
laws.description: Sending grossly offensive or menacing messages with intent to cause annoyance. Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 5 lakh rupees. (Note: Section 66A was partially struck down by SC in 2015)

laws.title: Identity theft
laws.description: Fraudulently or dishonestly uses electronic signature of another person. Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 1 lakh rupees.

laws.title: Punishment for impersonation using computer resource
laws.description: Impersonating through electronic means. Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 1 lakh rupees.

filing_procedure: File complaint with local police cybercrime cell (can file online on police website)
Provide screenshot/documentation of all harassing messages
Include URL/links and timestamps of posts if on public platform
Provide account details of person sending harassment
Report to social media platform: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Use platform's built-in reporting feature for blocking and escalation
Request police to preserve evidence from ISP/platform
File separate complaints if harassment on multiple platforms
Apply for blocking order: ask platform to block harasser's account
Keep records of all communication with police and platform
Request privacy settings review on personal accounts
Apply for anticipatory bail if threatened with legal action
Seek victim protection in online harassment cases

laws.title: Defamation
laws.description: Making or publishing any imputation concerning any person intending to harm, or knowing or having reason to believe that such imputation will harm, the reputation of such person.

laws.title: Criminal intimidation and threats
laws.description: Threats or intimidation causing fear; online threats and harassment may attract punishment under these provisions.

laws.title: Violation of privacy
laws.description: Punishment for capturing, publishing or transmitting the image of a private area of any person without his or her consent.

laws.title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
laws.description: Insulting the modesty of a person by words, gestures or acts, which may apply when online messages target a person's dignity.

laws.title: Publishing or transmitting obscene material in electronic form
laws.description: Punishment for publishing obscene content online which may be used to shame or harass victims.

filing_procedure: Collect and preserve screenshots, URLs, timestamps and message headers of abusive content
File complaint with local police cybercrime cell or file online on state police cyber portals
Provide links to social media posts and request takedown from the platform
File FIR under relevant IPC sections (e.g., 499, 503, 506, 509) and IT Act provisions as applicable
Request police to obtain subscriber information and preserve evidence from the platform/ISP
Request interim protection orders or blocking orders against harassers
Report abusive accounts to the social media platform and follow up for escalation
Seek civil remedies for defamation or privacy violations (send notice to platform/accused)
Obtain legal advice for takedown notices and cease-and-desist communications
Keep record of all communications with police and platform; seek victim support services if needed

laws.title: Right to equality, personal liberty, constitutional remedies

laws.act: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights Act, 2005
laws.title: Powers to inquire into violations

laws.act: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) Regulations
laws.title: Student protection and grievance redressal

filing_procedure: File formal written complaint with institution's grievance cell
Provide detailed evidence: documents, communications, witness statements
Request written acknowledgement of complaint filing
File Right to Information (RTI) request for institutional policies
Request meeting with ombudsman/grievance officer
Request interim protective measures pending investigation
Escalate to affiliating university if institution is unresponsive
File complaint with state education department
Contact National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (if applicable)
File public interest litigation in High Court if serious violations
Approach media and student organizations for pressure and publicity
Seek legal aid for representation in cases
Document all institutional responses for future legal proceedings

laws.title: Extortion
laws.description: Putting any person in fear of any injury and thereby dishonestly inducing that person to deliver property. Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 500 rupees.

laws.title: Punishment for extortion
laws.description: Rigorous imprisonment of up to 3 years and fine up to 5000 rupees.

laws.title: Dacoity and dacoity with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
laws.description: Organized extortion. Punishment up to 10 years imprisonment.

laws.title: Violation of privacy
laws.description: Publishing private images without consent. Punishment up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to 4 lakh rupees.

filing_procedure: File police complaint immediately with FIR
Provide all blackmail communications: messages, emails, calls
Include demands made and threats given
Report to cyber cell if extortion is online
Request police protection immediately
Do NOT pay any money to extortionist
Preserve all evidence in original format
Request anticipatory bail if threatened with exposure
Apply for restraining order/injunction
Report to social media platforms if threats posted publicly
File separate cyber complaint for privacy violation if applicable
Inform bank if financial extortion involved
Request witness protection if others are also being targeted

laws.title: Defamation
laws.description: Publishing or speaking false information that harms reputation. Punishment up to 2 years imprisonment, fine up to 5000 rupees, or both.

laws.title: Punishment for defamation
laws.description: Imprisonment up to 6 months and fine up to 500 rupees.

laws.title: Violation of privacy
laws.description: Capturing, publishing, or transmitting intimate image without consent. Punishment up to 3 years and fine up to 4 lakh rupees.

laws.title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
laws.description: Fraud and deception for obtaining property. Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine up to 1 lakh rupees.

filing_procedure: File civil defamation suit in District Court
Provide evidence: screenshots, documents, false statements published
Request immediate injunction to stop publishing false information
Simultaneously file police complaint for criminal defamation
Publish correction notice in same medium where defamation occurred
Send cease and desist letter through lawyer
File complaint with social media platforms
Request removal of defamatory content with timeline
Document all harm suffered (professional, personal, financial)
Claim damages in civil suit (actual, special, exemplary)
File cyber complaint if defamation online
Request court order for disclosure of anonymous poster's identity
Apply for temporary injunction ex-parte if urgency

laws.title: Right to equality
laws.description: State shall not deny any person equality before law or equal protection. Violation can be challenged.

laws.title: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth

laws.title: Protection against discrimination based on disability

File formal complaint with institution/organization

laws.title: Identity theft
laws.description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly makes use of the electronic signature, password or any other unique identification feature of any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine which may extend to rupees one lakh.

laws.title: Cheating by personation by using computer resource
laws.description: Whoever by means of computer resource or communications device cheats by personation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine which may extend to rupees one lakh.

laws.title: Defamation
laws.description: Whoever, by words either spoken or intended to be read, or by signs or by visible representations, makes or publishes any imputation concerning any person intending to harm his reputation or knowing it to be likely to harm his reputation, commits defamation.

laws.title: Punishment for defamation
laws.description: Whoever defames another shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

laws.title: Punishment for criminal breach of trust
laws.description: Whoever, being in any manner entrusted with property, or with any dominion over property in his capacity of a public servant or by virtue of any law for the time being in force, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of that property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine.

laws.title: Punishment for publishing obscene material in electronic form
laws.description: Applies if personal images are shared without consent along with impersonation.

filing_procedure: Screenshot and document fake profile/account with all posts and comments
Report fake account to social media platform immediately with evidence
Request platform to remove profile and block impersonator
File police complaint under IT Act 66C/66D at cyber crime cell
Provide all screenshots, profile links, and evidence of impersonation
Get case reference number from police
File defamation case in civil court if reputation damaged
Send legal notice to impersonator demanding removal of fake profile
Request platform to disclose IP address and user information to police
Monitor for continued impersonation activity

laws.title: Punishment for publishing obscene material in electronic form

Report to the online platform immediately
File complaint with Cyber Crime Cell / Police
